title: Bradyphrenia in parkinsonism: a historical review
abstract: Synopsis The development over the last 60 years of the concept of bradyphrenia, a syndrome including slowing of cognitive processing in parkinsonism, is described. Psychic akinesia and subcortical dementia are seen as more recent synonyms for this syndrome. Its relations to akinesia and the psychomotor retardation of depression are considered in a historical context, as are its implications for the relation of neurological and psychiatric disorder.
